arts.ttl: Neto and Fernandez give Chelsea win at Burnley
arts.sum: Goals from Pedro Neto and Enzo Fernandez give Chelsea a 2-0 victory against Burnley at Turf Moor.

arts.ttl: Burnley 0-2 Chelsea: Chelsea Post Match Player Ratings
arts.sum: Burnley dominated the opening half hour but lacked the attacking confidence to finish their chances, and could not find a way back into the game after going behind. Played a key role in the Blues' opener - controlling Tosin's long ball in the Burnley box amid pressure from two defenders.

arts.ttl: Burnley 0-2 Chelsea: Neto and Fernandez kickstart huge week with win over Burnley
arts.sum: Their eighth victory in ten games came courtesy of Pedro Neto ’s fourth goal of the campaign and Enzo Fernandez ’s late second as the visitors overcame a slow start to wing convincingly. Blocks from Santos, who was required more as a defensive presence than attacking one during Chelsea’s tepid start, and Tosin Adarabioyo were key in preventing Burnley from concluding their promising moves with efforts at goal.

arts.ttl: Chelsea boss Maresca heaps praise on midfielder after Burnley win
arts.sum: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca was full of praise for Andrey Santos following the midfielder’s performance in the club’s 2-0 win at Burnley. The West Londoners climbed to second in the Premier League after a professional performance at Turf Moor. Pedro Neto opened the scoring for Chelsea in the first half, following an excellent cross from […] The post Chelsea boss Maresca heaps praise on midfielder after Burnley win first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Enzo Maresca pleased to see Chelsea negotiate ‘tricky’ game after Burnley win
arts.sum: Goals from Pedro Neto and Enzo Fernandez gave Chelsea a 2-0 victory at Turf Moor.

arts.ttl: Chelsea 2-0 Burnley: Insane stat shows result is a game-changer for Maresca
arts.sum: In a first under Enzo Maresca, Chelsea comfortably defeated Burnley without star midfielder Moises Caicedo on Saturday afternoon. Chelsea 2-0 Burnley: Insane stat shows result is a game-changer for Maresca

arts.ttl: Burnley 0-2 Chelsea ANALYSIS: The star who was the Blues' most impressive player, Enzo Maresca's perfectly executed plan - and the real reason Reece James was taken off at half-time
arts.sum: KIERAN GILL AT TURF MOOR: Every now and then, the elite tacticians can be accused of trying to be too clever for their own good. Today that could not be levelled at Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca.

arts.ttl: Chelsea pass Burnley test, but Barcelona and Arsenal await in a big week
arts.sum: Chelsea weren't at their best vs. Burnley and got an important win, but they will need a bit more when facing Barcelona and Arsenal next.

arts.ttl: Better than Ancelotti? Maresca joins Chelsea greats with Burnley win
arts.sum: There were understandable doubts about Enzo Maresca's ability to manage at the top level - given his inexperience in only taking charge of Leicester City and Parma - when he took over at Chelsea in...

arts.ttl: Neto and Fernández ensure Chelsea avoid accidental slip with victory at Burnley
arts.sum: In a week when domestic accidents troubled Chelsea, they had no such issues at Burnley. Without the injured Cole Palmer, who fractured a toe after colliding with a door at home, they avoided a slip here, escaping without even a fissure. There was the occasional early threat of a bloody nose, but even not at full speed, Chelsea were able to halt Burnley’s industry. Pedro Neto and Enzo Fernández were the matchwinners but Chelsea did not make the most of dominating possession against a side that had two meek shots on target. Continue reading...
